summary: This document appears to be an FBI interview summary (302) of a female victim, detailing her introduction to and subsequent sexual abuse by Jeffrey Epstein and Ghislaine Maxwell in London starting when she was approximately 16-17 years old. It describes the grooming process, specific assaults, and the dynamics between Epstein, Maxwell, and the victim, as well as her later reflections and interactions with other associates.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Described as grooming the victim, introducing her to Jeffrey Epstein, facilitating and being present during sexual assaults, and using manipulative language similar to the victim's mother.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The primary perpetrator of sexual assaults against the victim, facilitated by Ghislaine Maxwell. The abuse began in London when the victim was approximately 17.

persons.name: Silver Bramham
persons.context: A friend of the victim who had a 21st birthday party in November 1993 which the victim attended. Both attended Oxford.

persons.name: Kevin
persons.context: A random man who helped the victim at an airport when she missed her flight back from Epstein's island, taking her to his home where his children lived.

persons.name: Lisa Bloom
persons.context: An attorney who spoke to the victim and Ghislaine Maxwell. The victim's first attorney, but she did not end up working with Bloom.

connections.description: Maxwell groomed and introduced the victim to Epstein, facilitated sexual assaults, and communicated with the victim about Epstein's satisfaction.
Maxwell held a birthday party for Silver Bramham in November 1993, which the victim attended.
Maxwell groomed the victim, used manipulative language, introduced her to Epstein, and facilitated sexual abuse.
Epstein sexually assaulted the victim on multiple occasions, with the abuse beginning in London when she was approximately 17.
Bloom was the victim's first attorney and spoke to her, but the victim did not end up working with her.
Bloom also spoke to Ghislaine Maxwell, according to the victim's account.

events.title: Silver Bramham's 21st Birthday Party
events.description: A birthday party held at a club called Samantha's for Silver Bramham, which the victim attended.

events.title: Victim Meets Ghislaine Maxwell and Jeffrey Epstein
events.description: The victim met Ghislaine Maxwell in early 1994 and was introduced to Jeffrey Epstein within the first couple of months. The sexual abuse began shortly after when she was approximately 17.

events.title: First Sexual Assaults by Epstein
events.description: The victim recalls approximately two assaults by Jeffrey Epstein at Maxwell's residence in Kensington, London, before she started traveling with them. Maxwell facilitated and was present during the grooming and initial assaults.

events.title: Trip to Epstein's Island
events.description: When the victim was approximately 21/22 years old, she traveled to Epstein's island. She returned a changed person, according to her friend.

events.title: Epstein's First Arrest
events.description: The victim had a conversation with an associate about Epstein's first arrest, expressing worry for him at the time, which she later regretted.

keyFacts: The victim was approximately 16-17 years old when she was groomed and introduced to Jeffrey Epstein by Ghislaine Maxwell in London in early 1994.
Ghislaine Maxwell used manipulative language similar to the victim's mother, saying things like 'I need you' and 'Don't disappoint me,' to control her and facilitate the abuse.
The first sexual assaults by Epstein occurred at Maxwell's residence in Kensington, with Maxwell present, hovering, and providing oil for the massage.
The victim received a Prada handbag for her 18th birthday with a gift tag saying 'Love, Jeffrey and Ghislaine,' indicating their ongoing involvement in her life.
The victim's friend observed that she returned from Epstein's island 'a different person,' and the victim herself recognized Maxwell's role in the abuse, stating Maxwell 'knew what was going on.'
